Data distributions

Source: R/DataDistribution.R
DataDistribution-class.Rd

DataDistribution is an abstract class used to represent the distribution of a sufficient statistic x given a sample size n and a single parameter value theta.

# S4 method for DataDistribution
quantile(x, probs, n, theta, ...)

probability_density_function(dist, x, n, theta, ...)


  # S4 method for DataDistribution,numeric,numeric,numeric
probability_density_function(dist,
  x, n, theta, ...)

cumulative_distribution_function(dist, x, n, theta, ...)


  # S4 method for DataDistribution,numeric,numeric,numeric
cumulative_distribution_function(dist,
  x, n, theta, ...)

Arguments

x

outcome
probs

numeric vector of probabilities
n

sample size
theta

distribution parameter
...

further optional arguments
dist

data distribution object

Details

This abstraction layer allows representation of t-distributions (unknown variance), normal distribution (known variance), and normal approximation of a binary endpoint. Currently, only the normal case is implemented with Normal-class.

Methods (by generic)

  • quantile: quantile function of the respective distribution.

  • probability_density_function: probability density function given outcome, sample size and parameter; must be implemented.

  • cumulative_distribution_function: cumulative distribution function given outcome, sample size and parameter; must be implemented.
